channel.title: 667 Changing The Power Of An Item!
channel.description:
[u][b][size=12pt]Adding bonuses to an item[/size][/b][/u]
You will have to download this to begin it contains the things for it - http://uppit.com/wyrfbkwggrsr/ItemPacker.rar
After you have downloaded it, extract it to your main folder where the src, bin, data, all that jazz is. Keep the ItemPacker.bat in that folder, move the ItemBonusPacker.java to your tools. Your tools are located at (server) -> src -> com -> rs -> tools Put your ItemBonusPacker.java in your tools folder. Put the bonus folder inside of your data -> items folder.
~ How to add bonuses ~ If you look inside of the Bonus folder, you will se .txt files with a bunch of numbers for names. Those numbers are item id's When you open one of them, 5658 for example, it should look like this.
[code]Attack bonus 0 0 0 0 10 Defence bonus 0 0 0 0 0 0 Damage absorption 0 0 0 Other bonuses 0 8 0 0
[/code]
This is a pretty obvious layout. Just change the 0s or whatevers in there to the amount you want. So to make it strong you would put like 300.
Here's how it goes.
[code] Attack bonus - Attack bonuse 0- Stab bonus 0- Slash bonus 0 - Crush bonus 0 - Magic bonus 10 - Range bonus Defence bonus - Defence bonuses 0 - Stab Defence bonus 0 - Slash Defence bonus 0 - Crush Defence bonus 0 - Magic Defence bonus 0 - Range Defence bonus 0 - Summoning Defence bonus Damage absorption - Damage Absorption Percentages 0 - Melee Damage Absorption Percentage 0 - Magic Damage Absorption Percentage 0 - Range Damage Absorption Percentage Other bonuses - Other bonuses 0 - Strengh Bonus 8 - Ranged Strength Bonus 0 - Prayer Bonus 0 - Magic Damage Boost Percentage [/code]
If you did this all right, and put everything in the right spot, just run ItemPacker.bat and run server.
Hope it helps.

item.title: 667 Changing The Power Of An Item!
item.dc:creator: @Aesyr Aesyr
item.description:
@Aesyr wrote:

svrking27:

i did this and it turned LL MY ITEM BONUSES TO 0…

Except the ones you changed, right?

Read full topic

item.title: 667 Changing The Power Of An Item!
item.dc:creator: @jackabe jackabe
item.description:
@jackabe wrote:

[size=12pt]Adding bonuses to an item[/size]

You will have to download this to begin it contains the things for it - http://uppit.com/wyrfbkwggrsr/ItemPacker.rar

After you have downloaded it, extract it to your main folder where the src, bin, data, all that jazz is.
Keep the ItemPacker.bat in that folder, move the ItemBonusPacker.java to your tools. Your tools are located at
(server) -> src -> com -> rs -> tools
Put your ItemBonusPacker.java in your tools folder.
Put the
bonus
folder inside of your data -> items folder.

~ How to add bonuses ~
If you look inside of the Bonus folder, you will se .txt files with a bunch of numbers for names. Those numbers are item id’s
When you open one of them, 5658 for example, it should look like this.

[code]Attack bonus
0
0
0
0
10
Defence bonus
0
0
0
0
0
0
Damage absorption
0
0
0
Other bonuses
0
8
0
0

[/code]

This is a pretty obvious layout. Just change the 0s or whatevers in there to the amount you want. So to make it strong you would put like 300.

Here’s how it goes.

Attack bonus - Attack bonuse
0- Stab bonus
0- Slash bonus
0 - Crush bonus
0 - Magic bonus
10 - Range bonus
Defence bonus - Defence bonuses
0 - Stab Defence bonus
0 - Slash Defence bonus
0 - Crush Defence bonus
0 - Magic Defence bonus
0 - Range Defence bonus
0 - Summoning Defence bonus
Damage absorption - Damage Absorption Percentages
0 - Melee Damage Absorption Percentage
0 - Magic Damage Absorption Percentage
0 - Range Damage Absorption Percentage
Other bonuses - Other bonuses
0 - Strengh Bonus
8 - Ranged Strength Bonus
0 - Prayer Bonus
0 - Magic Damage Boost Percentage

If you did this all right, and put everything in the right spot, just run ItemPacker.bat and run server.

Hope it helps.

Read full topic
